intro: Vernonia myriantha var. subuligera, commonly known as the slender vernonia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal applications.
